channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Drag artists are getting attacked. This safety handbook aims to help
item.description: A group of drag queens from across the country and their supporters are releasing a handbook to help performers navigate a landscape of increasing threats of harassment and violence.

item.title: Businesses and trading partners are in limbo after a pair of federal court rulings
item.description: Imports to the U.S. fell sharply last month, as President Trump's worldwide tariffs took effect. But the future of those tariffs is in question after a pair of federal court rulings this week.

item.title: Hamas says it sent its response to U.S. ceasefire proposal
item.description: Hamas has responded to a U.S. ceasefire proposal in Gaza that includes the release of around half of its remaining living hostages.

item.title: Mexico holds first-of-its-kind nationwide judicial elections
item.description: Mexico is set to elect its judges by popular vote â€” a move that critics warn could undermine judicial independence and empower organized crime.

item.title: What's it like to anchor NPR live special coverage?
item.description: What's it like to anchor NPR live special coverage? Two seasoned NPR hosts discuss.

item.title: Pete Hegseth discusses U.S. policy towards China at Singapore security conference
item.description: Defense Sec. Pete Hegseth signaled that the U.S. will reorient its policy towards "deterring aggression by communist China."

item.title: In the poetry collection 'Fierce Delight,' Emily Bright documents early motherhood
item.description: A new collection of poetry from Emily Bright explores the early days of motherhood.

item.title: Trump pardons drug kingpins even as he escalates U.S. drug war rhetoric
item.description: President Trump has promised to attack drug gangs and called for the death penalty for street dealers. But he has also pardoned more than 20 people serving time for serious drug crimes, some involving violence.

item.title: Worth playing for? An NPR producer recreates 'Survivor' with friends every year
item.description: After All Things Considered producer Mia Venkat became a fan of Survivor, she and her friend group play their own version every year.

item.title: President Trump's war on higher education
item.description: The Trump administration is at war with higher education. They've cut more than a billion dollars in research grants.
